alert.note: Alert for Amador; El Dorado; Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 9:47AM PDT until March 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Cosumnes River At Michigan Bar affecting El Dorado, Sacramento and Amador Counties. .Recent rains combined with an ongoing atmospheric river event will result in significant rises for the rivers. For the Lower San Joaquin River System...including Patterson, Vernalis...Major flooding is forecast. For the Cosumnes River...including Michigan Bar, McConnell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cosumnes River at Michigan Bar. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low lying lands along the river begin to flood. At 12.0 feet, Water flows on to the road near Wilton. At 13.2 feet, Water floods houses in Wilton. The south bank levee near Wilton is overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 12.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/08/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
